name: Bubble Tea
description: Places that sell the Taiwanese cold drink made with tea, milk, and tapioca pearls and other variations.

rankSlots.title: Fantastic
rankSlots.description: Really tasty bubble tea and/or unique concepts. If I could only go to once place, it'd be one of these

rankSlots.title: Great
rankSlots.description: Great bubble tea and worth visiting if you're in the area.

rankSlots.title: Fine
rankSlots.description: Pretty standard bubble tea without anything really setting it apart.

items.name: Brew Cha
items.comments: Delicious teas and interesting specialty drinks. One of the few places that sells a Ube Taro Latte! Unrelated, but it also has super fast free Wi-Fi.

items.name: Plentea
items.comments: Rich and generally delicious bubble tea, and they have a glass bottle option. They also have a non-powder taro milk tea and other interesting specialty drinks.

items.name: i-Tea Kearny
items.comments: Bubble tea isn't anything particularly special, but it is decent. Location was cash only under a certain amount.

items.name: Boba Guys
items.comments: Muscat Oolong is one of a kind. They're know for their long lines. This location is very small, so the line is outside along a busy street.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: Standard Gong Cha location, but the drinks coupled with its proximity to Union Square and Powell St BART and MUNI gives this place extra points for convenience.

items.name: Black Sugar - Boba Bar
items.comments: Small location with fairly limited options, but the drinks they offer are delicious, especially the Mango Matcha Latte and the Roasted Oolong Milk Tea

items.name: Purple Kow
items.comments: Standard milk teas with wide cups being the primary gimmick.

items.name: One Zo
items.comments: The drinks and homemade boba were pretty good, but the location itself was really dead and the staff were less than receptive when I went.

items.name: Teaspoon
items.comments: Huge variety of different teas, super aesthetic three-layer drinks, and fantastic shaved ice as a bonus. Located just blocks away from Redwood City Caltrain and Courthouse Square.

items.name: Tea & Milk
items.comments: One of just a few places in NYC that creates their own special bubble tea combinations. Some combinations seem weird at first, but the ones I've had have all been great. Also has some great bahn mis available.

items.name: T4
items.comments: Would frequent this location when I was in Palo Alto. Bubble tea is great, but nothing special that would justify a trip.

items.name: Sharetea
items.comments: Standard Sharetea location in downtown Palo Alto, but not any different than other locations in the Bay Area.

items.name: Feng Cha
items.comments: Bought a drink during an event, so I haven't gone to their physical location, but the bubble tea is a tea + foam + topping combination that is very instagrammable and very tasty.

items.name: Sharetea
items.comments: Standard Sharetea location located inside the Westfield. This location gets bonus points for being accessible via the BART/MUNI concourse without having to go outside and generally quick service.

items.name: Boba Guys
items.comments: Similar story to their location on Stockton, but the store is slightly larger with some seating and a much quieter streetscape when there's a line.

items.name: Tea & Milk
items.address: 75 9th Ave, Chelsea Market Lower Level, New York, NY 10011, US
items.comments: Similar to their Astoria location but is a stand instead of a physical storefront, so it can get a bit cramped. Drinks are fantastic!

items.name: Qualitea
items.comments: One of the only bubble tea locations in the Castro, and a really great location at that. Their strawberry-matcha latte is arguably better (and more aesthetic) than that of Boba Guys, and they have many more options available.

items.name: Bopomofo Cafe
items.address: 841 W Las Tunas Dr, San Gabriel, CA 91776
items.comments: Have not gone to their physical location, but the drink I got at an event was really great with a distinct tea flavor.

items.name: The Alley
items.comments: Fairly limited in terms of variety, but the drinks are really great for the options they do have. This location in particular is near NYU, St. Marks Pl, and might as well be on top of the 6 train station.

items.name: Bar Pa Tea
items.comments: Definitely very unique and delicious tea lattes, but also known for their boba soft serve.

items.name: Le Tea
items.comments: The milk tea is pretty average, but my order came with a metal straw and sturdy reusable plastic container.

items.name: Tea Do
items.comments: The tea here was fairly watery and wasn't anything particularly special.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.comments: Standard Kung Fu Tea location with the menu and convenience that comes with the chain.

items.name: Magic Bubble Tea
items.comments: Location does primarily powdered bubble tea and the boba is fairly tasteless, but it is also one of the only bubble tea places in the region.

items.name: Moge Tee
items.comments: Known for their cheese tea, the location has surprisingly rich and creamy drinks. They use a milk tea base with mix-ins like oreo and red bean, which limits options. Location is not quite worth the Metrobus trip if you are not local.

items.name: Sharetea
items.comments: Standard Sharetea location with great drinks consistent with other Sharetea locations. It should be noted that the location is not wheelchair accessible

items.name: Sweet Hut
items.address: 935 Peachtree St NE UNIT 935, Atlanta, GA 30309
items.comments: Bubble teas are generally more watery than milky, but it is also one of only a few bubble tea places in the city limits and in Midtown. Also serves food, so check out the entry on my Restaurants list.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.address: 2 Park Pl NE South, Atlanta, GA 30303
items.comments: Standard Kung Fu Tea location on the GSU campus and close proximity to Five Points MARTA.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.comments: Standard Kung Fu Tea location on Buford Highway, but not worth the trip out unless you happen to be in the area.

items.name: Tea House Formosa
items.address: 5302 Buford Hwy NE A3, Atlanta, GA 30340
items.comments: Pretty decent bubble tea and better than Kung Fu Tea right nearby, but doesn't do anything special that makes a dedicated trip worth it.

items.name: Ding Tea
items.address: 5150 Buford Hwy NE C150, Doraville, GA 30340
items.comments: Serves golden boba in addition to regular boba, and a large selection of high quality drinks.

items.name: Tea Top
items.address: 6035 Peachtree Rd Suite A117, Doraville, GA 30360
items.comments: On the milkier side of bubble teas and pretty tasty, but the bubble tea also leaves a strange aftertaste, likely due to the dairy-free creamers.

items.name: Chatime
items.comments: Milk tea was very watery, boba had no flavor, and was the first time I was disappointed after drinking a bubble tea.

items.name: Urban Ritual Cafe
items.comments: On the more watery side of bubble teas, and it is fairly expensive relative to what you get.

items.name: Happy Lemon
items.address: The Shops at Tanforan, Tanforan Way, San Bruno, CA 94066
items.comments: Known more for their cheese teas, they have a normal bubble tea option that does the job, and was one of the only places you can get a bubble tea in San Bruno.

items.name: T4
items.address: 13350 San Pablo Ave, San Pablo, CA 94806
items.comments: Standard T4 location but leaves a little more to be desired compared to the Palo Alto location.

items.name: Little Sweet
items.comments: Drinks have a great balance of tea flavor and sweetness that I haven't seen at other locations.

items.name: Cool Tea Bar
items.comments: Definitely closer to the powdery side of bubble teas, and their large size is absurdly large.

items.name: CoCo
items.comments: Standard CoCo location, notable for having a location on Market St.

items.name: STEAP Tea Bar
items.comments: Pretty unique milk tea that has a variety of brewed teas and flavors

items.name: Breaktime Tea
items.address: 110 E San Fernando St, San Jose, CA 95112
items.comments: There was not anything special about this location aside from being one of a few dedicated bubble tea places in Downtown.

items.name: Tea Do
items.comments: Similar to the Philadelphia Chinatown location, but with the bonus that it is open later.

items.name: Unbelibubble Tea House
items.comments: Decent bubble tea, but nothing particularly unbelibubble.

items.name: Poke Bar
items.comments: The purchase of the bubble tea here seemed forced, and while it seemed like they brewed their own tea, the drink was definitely closer to sugary tea with a hint of cream, and the boba was tasteless.

items.name: Jasmine Smoothie World
items.comments: A powdered bubble tea location, but located in a region that has very few places that sell bubble tea.

items.name: Identitea
items.comments: The bubble tea was pretty tasty and is also adjacent to a poke place, but selection was fairly limited.

items.name: Mr. Wish
items.comments: On the watery side of bubble tea and rather inconvenient to get to.

items.name: Tea Do
items.comments: I was plesantly surprised with this location given my experience with Tea Do. The bubble tea was not too creamy and not too sweet and the boba was flavorful.

items.name: Honey Bubble
items.address: 798 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306
items.comments: This place could certainly be more convenient as there is not too much adjacent to this location. The bubble tea was pretty meh overall.

items.name: Hui Tea
items.comments: Creamy bubble tea and a distinct flavor, located directly above Canal St 6NQRWJZ

items.name: Feng Cha
items.comments: Boba + tea + milk foam combination that, while separate from their actual milk tea option, is delicious and certainly a departure from the creamy, oversweetend drinks.

items.name: Tiger Sugar
items.comments: This chain has a lot of hype surrounding it. Their drinks are aeshetic but also almost exclusively the brown sugar variety. Lines are usually pretty long, with the added inconvenience of the line situated along one the busiest pedestian streets in the city.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: A standard Gong Cha location with close proximity to the Fulton Mall and a great option if you're in Downtown Brooklyn.

items.name: Ten Ren's Tea Time
items.comments: Definitely good bubble teas, but the drinks weren't anything super special.

items.name: Pa Tea
items.comments: Drinks are pretty great but also pretty standard.

items.name: Yi Fang Taiwan Fruit Tea
items.comments: One of the only bubble tea places on the southern half of Long Island City. Their tea lattes have a great mix of tea and milk flavors, and their mini-boba is the main thing that keeps me going back.

items.name: Rabbit Rabbit Tea
items.comments: Great location, great drinks.

items.name: Panda Bubble Tea
items.comments: The bubble tea is fine, but nothing to write home about. This place gets points for its location in the Turnstyle Market underneath Columbus Circle and its proximity to 59th-Columbus Circle station.

items.name: Lazy Sundaes
items.comments: Formerlly Boba Guys, the drinks are shared with that of Boba Guys, and with that comes the quality and lines I expect from Boba Guys.

items.name: iF Cha
items.comments: Overall great bubble tea place, with some aesthetic drinks and tasty boba.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.comments: Otherwise decent Kung Fu Tea location, but the milk tea here isn't anything to write home about.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: Unexpectedly terrible. The tea had a strange taste to it that made me throw out the drink before finishing.

items.name: Momentea
items.comments: Bubble tea here is rather uninspired but does the job.

items.name: Teazzi
items.comments: Fantastic and authentic milk tea and boba and served in paper cups, which also means you can't see the drink when you get it, but is more environmentally mindful.

items.name: Anda Cafe
items.comments: Great bubble tea, but nothing particularly unique about their drinks.

items.name: Ho Ho Te
items.comments: Great bubble tea place near the theater district, and great selection of drinks and snacks. THe taste is very distinct, so some may not enjoy it as much.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.comments: Standard Kung Fu Tea location, but cash only below a certain amount, which means you can't use your rewards at this location unless you buy at least 2 drinks.

items.name: Panda Bubble Tea
items.comments: Gets the job done, but the drink and boba are pretty bland.

items.name: Yi Fang Taiwan Fruit Tea
items.address: 33 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003
items.comments: Normal Yi Fang location, so great bubble tea and mini boba.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: Right in the heart of Times Square, this location is extremely convenient if you happen to be in the area, and has great and consistent drinks.

items.name: Yaya Tea
items.comments: Great Yaya Tea location with great drinks and boba.

items.name: Lazy Sundaes
items.comments: Formerly Boba Guys, Lazy Sundaes still has the same drinks and same quality, and do a great job with unique flavor combinations, not to mention great online ordering for pickup.

items.name: KOI Thé
items.comments: Really great bubble tea and really tasty golden boba.

items.name: Chun Yang Tea
items.comments: Really great bubble tea, with boba that is softer than usual. This location is cash only below a certain amount.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: Standard Gong Cha location, but super consistent in quality of milk tea and boba.

items.name: KOI Thé
items.address: 32 Union Square E, New York, NY 10003
items.comments: Fantastic bubble tea with golden boba and really friendly staff.

items.name: Gong Cha
items.comments: Standard Gong Cha location tucked away off 6th Ave, but tea wasn't quite as rich as Gong Cha usually is.

items.name: Dragon Horn Tea
items.comments: Great milk tea and boba in one of the only bubble tea places in FiDi.

items.name: Tea Time
items.comments: Decent bubble tea and flavors, but boba is fairly bland.

items.name: TruTea
items.comments: Bubble tea is decent but nothing special.

items.name: Infinitea
items.comments: The milk tea tastes fantastic, and the tea + milk flavors mix super well to create a really rich drink.

items.name: Pig Pig Cafe
items.comments: One of few locations in Bay Ridge, but the store itself is really cute and the staff are very friendly. The bubble tea is pretty decent, and the boba itself tastes great.

items.name: Yi Fang Taiwan Fruit Tea
items.comments: Great Yi Fang location, with quality drinks, mini-boba, and accepts cards with no surcharge.

items.name: Chun Yang Tea
items.comments: Really tasty bubble tea, unique flavors, and soft boba. Boba is also cooked fresh.

items.name: Mr. Wish
items.address: 690 W Dekalb Pike Ste 1071, King of Prussia, PA 19406
items.comments: On the watery side of bubble teas, and the boba is not super flavorful, but it's one of the only options in the KOP area.

items.name: Kung Fu Tea
items.comments: This location is combined with a TKK Fried Chicken, making it a decent option for a meal. This is an otherwise normal Kung Fu Tea location, but they tend to underfill drinks, and the drinks don't taste as flavorful as other locations.

items.name: Yaya Tea
items.comments: Great milk teas with plenty of options. Boba has great flavor.

items.name: One Zo
items.comments: The primary gimmick is a wide variety of different types of boba, including mango, taro, and sesame. The boba itself is arguably light in flavor, but an interesting departure from the standard bubble tea.

items.name: Debutea
items.comments: Definitely on the creamier side, but still pretty tasty. There are wide variety of teas, including 4 types of oolong tea, alongside an assortment of cheese and fruit-based teas.

items.name: Moge Tee
items.comments: The drink was good, but this location in particular lists cash prices and will automatically apply a 13% (definitely above normal) surcharge if you use a card, which they do not mention when you give them your card.
